thread.title: Capitals vs. Flames: Game 5 discussion thread
thread.title_full: Capitals vs. Flames: Game 5 discussion thread

title: Capitals vs. Flames: Game 5 discussion thread
text:
By Isabelle Khurshudyan October 20 at 8:46 PM Follow @ikhurshudyan (AP Photo/Alex Brandon) 
CALGARY—The Washington Capitals are riding a two-game win streak and are finally healthy for their first road test of the season at Calgary. 
If it’s not broken, then why fix it? Coach Barry Trotz has kept the lineup the same as the last game, when the Capitals beat the Hurricanes, 4-1. That means Nicklas Backstrom remains the second-line center with Evgeny Kuznetsov anchoring the top line. 
Star left winger Alex Ovechkin has scored a goal in every game he’s played in so far, but he’ll just need a point to reach a historic milestone against the Flames. He currently has 899 points and he would be the first player in franchise history with 900 points. 
The lineup is below, and the discussion thread is now open. 
Forwards
